definition: hard to pass
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation

sentences.english: The beaten path is the safest, but the traffic's terrible.
sentences.chinese: 踏平的道路最安全，但是壅塞難行。

sentences.english: Truth melodious rhythm, practice hard line.
Inthelong river of China history, it walked along the zigzag riverbed.
sentences.chinese: 在中國歷史的長河中，它沿着曲折的河牀艱難行進。

sentences.english: It is rainy season now and the roads are difficult.
sentences.chinese: 這段時間是雨季，道路崎嶇難行。

sentences.english: Miao-Feng Road, formerly the dirt roads, rugged.
sentences.chinese: 妙峯古道，原爲土路，崎嶇難行。

sentences.english: Three college girls driving in a hard-driving rainstorm crash their car.
sentences.chinese: 三個女學生在暴風雨中行駛，幾乎寸步難行。

sentences.english: This is where Singaporeans must remain more united to face the rougher times ahead.
sentences.chinese: 前路難行，新加坡人這一刻就應該更加團結。

sentences.english: Often these schools were "boarding schools" because roads were rough or distance great.
sentences.chinese: 因爲路遠難行，這些學校往往都是“寄宿學校”。

sentences.english: The your world has not been difficult, I am stranded in-situ, no matter what recollection agglutination.
sentences.chinese: 沒有你世界寸步難行，我困在原地任回憶凝集。

sentences.english: Others make it to the sand bank in the middle but from there they are unable to move.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些陷在了中間的沙灘上，寸步難行。

sentences.english: The back mountain is only a barren one, whose pathway is full of stone riprap and overgrown with weeds, rugged and rough, difficult to walk by foot.
sentences.chinese: 後山不過是個虛山，山徑亂石野草，崎嶇難行。

sentences.english: The difficulty of law implementation has already been an obvious problem in China's actual legal life.
sentences.chinese: 法之難行已是中國法律實際生活的顯豁病症。

sentences.english: The children had been shipped off to boarding-school at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 因爲路遠難行，這些學校往往都是“寄宿學校”。

sentences.english: But new taxes are bureaucratically complex to impose in China.
sentences.chinese: 但新的稅率在中國官僚體系中滯礙難行。

sentences.english: The your world has not been difficult, I was stranded in-situ, no matter what recollection agglutination.
sentences.chinese: 沒有你世界寸步難行，我困在原地任回憶凝集。

sentences.english: The chair was stuck to her and she could hardly walk.
sentences.chinese: 可是一把椅子攔住了她的路，讓她寸步難行。

definition: rugged/craggy
muddy/mud
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
dangerous and difficult (path)
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to stop up/to close up/hard to get to/out of the way/inaccessible/unenlightened/blocking
scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
key information/instructions/it must be borne in mind
arduous/steep
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
winding road/roundabout route/detour/(fig.) wrong way (of doing sth)
to clog up/silted up
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
unable to move a single step (idiom)/to be in an (extremely) difficult situation
